edu.wsu.KepheraSimulator
Class CurrentRobotState

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.wsu.KepheraSimulator.CurrentRobotState
public class CurrentRobotState
extends java.lang.Object

The CurrentRobotState class represents the current state of the robot at any time. This class provides methods to set the current state of the robot as well as to get the current state.

Constructor Detail

CurrentRobotState

public CurrentRobotState()
Allocates a new CurrentRobotState object. This object is initialized and set to a default state.

Method Detail

reInitialize

protected void reInitialize()
Reinitialize this CurrentRobotState object. This will reset the current state of the robot back to the default state.

getArmState

protected int getArmState()
Get the arm state of the robot. The state is either ARM_UP or ARM_DOWN.

Returns:
the arm state.

setArmState

protected void setArmState(int arm)
Set the arm state of the robot. The The state is either ARM_UP or ARM_DOWN.

Parameters:
arm - the arm state

getGripperState

protected int getGripperState()
Get the gripper state of the robot. The state is either GRIP_OPEN or GRIP_CLOSED.

Returns:
the gripper state

setGripperState

protected void setGripperState(int grip)
Set the gripper state of the robot. The state is either GRIP_OPEN or GRIP_CLOSED.

Parameters:
grip - the gripper state

the robots Motor object

Parameters:

getSensorValues

protected Sensor[] getSensorValues()
Provides the all of the Sensor objects of the robot.

Returns:
an array of Sensor objects where each contains the current sensor state.

Parameters:

protected boolean isObjectPresent()
Provide state information about whether an object exists between the gripper arms of the robot.

Returns:

getRobotCoordinates

protected RobotCoordinates getRobotCoordinates()
Provide the current position and orientation of the robot.

Returns:

                                   int y,
                                   float a)
Set the current position and orientation of the robot.

Parameters:

y - the y-coordinate position of the robot
